name: Natasha Syed
about: With over 15 years of work experience in various fields, Natasha is a passionate and visionary leader who strives to create positive social and environmental impact through innovation, education, and collaboration. Natasha is the founder and CEO of SkilledIn Green, a gamified talent marketplace that empowers people to unleash their potential and pursue careers in the green economy. Natasha holds a CIMA Advanced Diploma in Management Accounting and is a Certified Work Futurist accredited by the Institute for the Future. She is also an Economist, UX designer,  and a Cybersecurity professional.At SkilledIn, Natasha leads a diverse and talented team of engineers and marketers who share a common vision of transforming the way people learn, work, and grow.

name: Hassan Zaidi
about: Hassan, a skilled IT professional at Skilledin Green, brings a powerful combination of technical expertise and user focus to every project. As a Cloud Architect, his ever-expanding skillset ensures Skilledin Green operates swiftly and efficiently. Whether optimizing services for leaner operations or fine-tuning the tech stack, Hassan's knowledge fosters continuous agility. But Hassan's talents don't stop at the cloud. His passion for user experience shines through his frontend development skills. With a keen eye for detail, he meticulously scrutinizes every aspect of the user interface, relentlessly seeking opportunities to improve the user journey. From load times to UI elements, Hassan ensures a delightful and intuitive experience for all who interact with Skilledin Green's platform. Beyond the digital realm, Hassan possesses a strong sense of social responsibility. He understands the impact technology can have on a global scale, and firmly believes that even the smallest contributions can make a a significant difference. Every line of code he writes reflects a vision for a greener future, one where Skilledin Green stands at the forefront of sustainable innovation. As you explore Skilledin Green, know that Hassan's dedication and expertise are woven into the very fabric of the platform. He embodies the company's commitment to innovation, user-centric design, and a positive global impact.

name: Zainul Alim
about: Inul, a Full-Stack Developer at Skilledin Green, injects a refreshing perspective by blending his psychology background with practical software development skills. This unique synergy fuels his user-centric approach, ensuring every project prioritizes intuitive and user-friendly solutions. A fast learner who thrives on the ever-evolving tech landscape, Inul continuously expands his skillset within Skilledin Green. Currently, he's delving into Native Cloud Development, showcasing his commitment to staying at the forefront of technology. Inul's passion lies in crafting efficient, user-friendly applications that create a positive impact. He's particularly drawn to innovative projects that push the boundaries of technology for a sustainable future, aligning perfectly with Skilledin Green's mission. Inul's unique skillset, fueled by his psychology background and unwavering commitment to continuous learning, positions him as a key player at the forefront of green tech innovation. He's a forward-thinking developer dedicated to creating user-centric solutions for a more sustainable future.

name: Nasution
about: Nas, a results-oriented Full-Stack Software Engineer at Skilledin Green with over six years of experience, leverages his leadership, comprehensive technical skills, and dedication to lifelong learning to drive impactful solutions. Recognized for his ability to guide teams efficiently, Nas fosters a collaborative environment that tackles complex projects and delivers superior outcomes. His comprehensive grasp encompasses the entire software development spectrum, from user interface (front-end) design to server-side (back-end) logic and mobile application development. This versatility empowers him to architect and develop robust, scalable applications that directly address the needs of the green economy. Aligning with Skilledin Green's commitment to sustainability, Nas is actively pursuing a Master's degree in Computer Science at Gadjah Mada University. This dedication to continuous learning positions him as a visionary leader at the forefront of sustainable technological innovation. Nas's proven track record, combined with his technical expertise and commitment to continuous learning, makes him a valuable asset to the team. He is a driving force for leveraging technology to create impactful solutions that promote a more sustainable future.

name: A.A. Sumitro
about: Agus is a highly accomplished Software Engineer at Skilledin Green with nearly a decade of experience crafting innovative and secure software solutions. Driven by a deep passion for technology and a commitment to sustainability, he excels in designing and developing clean, maintainable code with a long-term vision for project success and environmental impact. Agus possesses a remarkable ability to adapt and thrive in diverse environments. His career spans the enterprise and government sectors, where he honed his skills in building large-scale systems. He has also flourished in the dynamic world of startups, particularly at Skilledin Green, where his agility and problem-solving skills were instrumental in tackling novel and cutting-edge projects that contribute to the green economy. A dedicated lifelong learner, Agus is committed to staying at the forefront of technological advancements, particularly those that can be leveraged for a sustainable future. He continuously expands his knowledge base and explores emerging trends to ensure his skills remain relevant and valuable in driving positive environmental change through technology.

name: Nuke Gunarto
about: Leveraging a unique combination of market expertise and unwavering environmental commitment, Nuke thrives as a Market Development Executive at SkilledIn Green. With nearly a decade of experience, she crafts strategic commercial initiatives that drive company growth in Indonesia, all while prioritizing sustainable practices. Nuke's dedication transcends the corporate realm. A recognized leader in the sustainability sphere, she has honed her skills through extensive work with prominent NGOs and youth empowerment programs. This culminated in the prestigious Ashoka Young Changemakers award in 2021, recognizing her impactful program that empowered over 3,000 Indonesian youth for careers fostering environmental well-being. Beyond her deep knowledge of green economy, sustainability, and climate change, Nuke brings a positive and collaborative spirit. This, combined with her expertise, makes her a right person to discuss with and a relentless advocate for a more sustainable future.

name: Prof. May Tan-Mullins
about: May Tan-Mullins joined James Cook University Singapore on 1 Sept 2021 as Dean International and additionally became the Chief Sustainability Officer on 21 April 2022. Her main portfolio includes recruitment, external relations, industry and community engagement and advancing the sustainability agenda at the university level. Prior to this position, she was the Vice Provost of Teaching and Learning at University of Nottingham Ningbo China. Her past senior leadership experience include Associate Provost for Global Engagement, Dean of Graduate School and the Director of Institute of Asia and Pacific Studies. She is also a professor in International Relations and her research interests are political ecology of rising China, environmental and energy justice, poverty alleviation and building resilience for the poorest and most vulnerable against climate change. Based on her expertise in various international development and human security issues, she is a consultant for the UNDP, National Bureau of Asian Research (US), the Revenue Watch Institute (US) and the Chinese government.  Professor May Tan-Mullins was awarded multiple provincial and municipal awards by the Chinese government and the prestigious global Rockefeller Bellagio writing residency in Bellagio Centre, Lake Como in Italy.

name: Dr. Dalal AlGhawas
about: Dr. Dalal AlChawas is the Founder of SWAPAC, an agrifood consultancy focused on food security and bridging the commercial and cultural worlds in the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) and Asia Pacific. She is a specialist, investing in future food technologies. Combining research, commercialization, capital and partnership to support high growth startups. Technical specialisation in food safety, biotechnology, diagnostics, clinical research and public health. Established the first food technology accelerator in Hong Kong and the World's first Alternative Protein accelerator. She has worked with >100 global technology startups. Focused on food-and agri-tech, next-generation foods, alternative protein, cellular- agriculture, Halal guidelines, sustainability, smart kitchen equipment, med-tech and software. International thought leader in the food technology space 100+ conferences, TV, podcasts, roundtables, industry reports, start-up competitions.Kuwaiti Citizen, Hong Kong Permanent Resident, well connected in APAC and GCC. Doctor of Philosophy (Food Science and Food Biotechnology) from leading Asian University of Hong Kong with publications in top tier peer reviewed journals, startup manuals and industry reports.

name: Luis Chan, CESGA
about: Louis is currently the sustainability manager for an investment holding company. In his role, he assumes leadership in the formulation of sustainability strategies and policies, conducts ESG due diligence and also the sustainability reporting efforts with the subsidiaries. In addition, as a Trustee for a UK charity, Louis has played a key role in the establishment and enforcement of robust sustainability policies. His visionary approach ensures the charity's unwavering commitment to achieving carbon neutrality by 2030, thereby making a tangible impact on global environmental goals. Louis has also co-founded and advised various start-ups, primarily in the climate-tech space and he specialises in helping businesses scale and doing investor relations work. Personally, he enjoys navigating the intricacies of capital markets to drive positive change and sustainable investments.Louis boasts a distinguished professional profile, holding coveted credentials such as the Certified Sustainability Excellence Associate (SEA) from the esteemed International Society of Sustainability Professionals. His expertise extends further as a Certified ESG Analyst and a holder of the GARP SCR designation, showcasing a comprehensive understanding of Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) principles. Most recently, Louis completed the prestigious Sustainability course with MIT Professional Education, further solidifying his position at the forefront of the sustainability landscape.
